alert.note: Alert for Western Kenai Peninsula (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 21 at 3:47PM AKST until February 21 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST THIS EVENING FROM CLAM GULCH NORTHWARD... * WHAT...Snow occurring. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches. Highest additional amounts near Nikiski. * WHERE...From Clam Gulch northward. * WHEN...Until 6 PM AKST this evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow is expected to continue for the next couple of hours especially from Soldotna to Nikiski. Lesser snow amounts closer to 2 inches are expected near Soldotna to Kenai with closer to 4 inches near Nikiski. Precipitation is expected to change over to rain especially for Soldotna later this evening. Kenai remains close to the edge of the rain/snow line with uncertainty remaining on whether or not it changes to rain. Nikiski where the deeper cold air remains is expected to hold on to all snow.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
